questions.question: If I don't drink tea in the morning, I ............................. sleepy.
questions.description: We can use the zero or first conditional here because we are talking about a real and possible situation. In the zero conditional, we use a simple present tense in both clauses and in the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + infinitive in the result clause.

questions.question: If she arrived, we ......................... her with open arms.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: I ....................... you if you say that word again.

questions.question: If I had been there, I ................................. you.
